title: 25 Terrorists, 5 Soldiers Dead In Fresh Pakistan-Afghanistan Border Clashes
content: Five Pakistani soldiers and 25 terrorists have died in clashes near the border with Afghanistan, the military said on Sunday, as delegations from both countries met to try to defuse tensions after the deadliest fighting in years.

title: India, China Resume Direct Flights From Kolkata to Guangzhou After 5 Years
content: After a hiatus of over four years, direct commercial air services between Kolkata and mainland China's Guangzhou city resumed on Sunday with the first flight taking off from the Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport at 10 pm.

title: 22-Year-Old Law Student's Stomach Cut Open, Fingers Chopped Off In Kanpur: Cops
content: A 22-year-old law student's stomach was cut open, his fingers chopped off after an argument with a medical shop operator in Kanpur, police said.

title: Woman, Lover Strangle Husband In Sleep In UP, Try To Frame His Family
content: A woman and her lover were arrested in the Bahraich district for allegedly murdering her husband, who had opposed the relationship, police said on Sunday.

title: Fearing Floods, Chennai Residents Move To Top Floors In Low-Lying Areas
content: Residents in several low-lying parts of South Chennai - already known flood-prone zones - have begun shifting their belongings to upper floors, fearing inundation ahead of the next spell of rain.

title: New Twist In Satara Doctor Suicide Case: Woman's False Postmortem Report Claim
content: The doctor in Maharashtra who died by suicide has signed a fake postmortem report, a woman from Satara has alleged.

title: Chhath Politics: AAP-BJP Face Off Over 'Fake Ghat' And Yamuna Pollution
content: A political row erupted in Delhi on Sunday after the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) accused the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) of setting up a "fake Yamuna ghat" with filtered water for Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Chhath Puja celebrations.

title: Russia Slams "Titanic Attempts" To Block US Talks Amid Tensions
content: Russia's top economic negotiator on Sunday slammed "titanic attempts" to thwart dialogue with the United States as he visited the country for talks with American officials after Washington imposed sanctions on Moscow's oil companies.

title: Where First Ladies Made History: Legacy Of White House East Wing Trump Razed
content: Betty Ford reportedly said that if the White House West Wing is the "mind" of the nation, then the East Wing - the traditional power centre for first ladies - is the "heart."

title: Rajasthan Officer's Wife Earns Rs 37.54 Lakh 'Salary' From 2 Firms Without Working
content: In nearly two years, she never went to either office yet earned Rs 37.54 lakh in 'salary' as an alleged employee of the companies.

title: Top US Official Signals Last-Minute Deal With China Ahead Of Trump-Xi Meet
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on Sunday signalled a deal with China to avoid escalating a tariff-fueled trade war, just days before a summit between Presidents Donald Trump and Xi Jinping.

title: Prince Andrew May Be Kicked Out Of UK Royal Palace. Here's Why
content: Britain's scandal-tarred Prince Andrew faced continued scrutiny Sunday of his contentious living arrangements and titles, amid reports of talks with King Charles III about vacating his 30-room royal residence.

title: "US Seeks Closer Ties With Pak, But Not At India's Expense": Marco Rubio
content: The US sees an opportunity to expand its strategic relationship with Pakistan but it will not be at the expense of its historic and important ties with India, US Secretary of State Marco Rubio has said.

title: Indian Man Carves World's Smallest Spoon: You'll Need a Microscope To See It
content: A 23-year-old miniature artist from Odisha's Ganjam district has set a new Guinness World Record for crafting the smallest wooden spoon.

title: "Lesson For Them": Madhya Pradesh Minister's Shocker On Australian Cricketers' Molestation
content: Even as India hosts the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup 2025, a shocking crime in Indore has overshadowed the tournament's spirit.

title: Nepal PM Expands Cabinet, Appoints Two Youth Icons As Ministers
content: Nepal's Prime Minister Sushila Karki expanded on Sunday her interim cabinet, which was formed in the wake of a youth-led uprising last month, inducting two ministers seen as popular among young people.

title: Nitish Kumar Visits Chirag Paswan's Home For Chhath Puja Ritual
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar on Sunday drove down to the residence of Union minister Chirag Paswan to partake 'kharna prasad", which devotees consume before embarking on a gruelling 36-hour-long fast as part of Chhath Puja.

title: Rahul Gandhi, Sonia Gandhi Among 40 Star Campaigners For Bihar Elections
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge and senior leaders Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, Kanhaiya Kumar and Independent MP Pappu Yadav are among the party's 40 star campaigners for the first phase of the Bihar assembly polls.

title: The Washington Post Can Question, But India Knows LIC Delivers
content: If there is one institution that commands unshakable faith across India, it is the Life Insurance Corporation or LIC. More than an insurer, it is a symbol of trust woven into India's social and economic fabric.

title: Another Hit Job Falls Flat: Washington Post's Credibility Crisis in India
content: Once celebrated as a global symbol of fearless journalism, the Washington Post today faces serious questions about its credibility in India.

title: RB Skattebo carted off with serious ankle injury
content: Giants rookie running back Cam Skattebo was carted off the field Sunday with a gruesome right ankle injury.

title: Former Jets star center Mangold dies at age 41
content: Former New York Jets center Nick Mangold has died due to complications from kidney disease. He was 41.

title: Doncic sidelined with finger sprain, leg contusion
content: Los Angeles Lakers star Luka Doncic is out for at least one week with a left finger sprain and lower left leg contusion.

title: Capitals fire Love following NHL's investigation
content: Washington Capitals assistant coach Mitch Love, 41, was relieved of his duties, effective immediately, the team announced on Sunday in a statement that added "this decision follows the findings of an NHL-led investigation into past allegations."

title: Henry passes Payton for 5th all-time in rush TDs
content: Ravens running back Derrick Henry went untouched on a 2-yard run Sunday for the 111th rushing touchdown of his career, which moved him past Walter Payton for sole possession of fifth place on the NFL's all-time list.

title: Vandy inches up to No. 9 in poll; LSU drops out
content: Vanderbilt earned its highest AP Top 25 ranking in 88 years, while LSU dropped out of the poll following its third loss in four games.

title: Spurs quietly unveil banner to honor Pop's career
content: The Spurs, without a public ceremony, quietly unveiled a banner honoring the Hall of Fame career of Gregg Popovich, who had 1,390 wins and five NBA titles as their coach.

title: Barça's De Jong slams Carvajal for Yamal 'scene'
content: Barcelona's Frenkie de Jong criticized Dani Carvajal's provocation of Lamine Yamal at the end of an ill-tempered Clásico, which ended with both sets of players scuffling on the pitch after the game.

title: What did we learn in NFL Week 8? Our big takeaways and looming questions off every single game
content: Our NFL Nation reporters answer the biggest questions out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 8.

title: Alonso turns Clásico tide in Madrid's favor with statement win over Barça
content: Real Madrid lost to Barcelona four times last season. Xabi Alonso proved why he's the man for Los Blancos' job.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes: What to make of big games from Ty Simpson, Anthony Hill Jr.
content: Could Ty Simpson be the QB1? Is Anthony Hill Jr. climbing the LB ranks again? We have notes on NFL prospects through CFB Week 9.

title: Eze gives Arsenal a 'magic moment' to sink old club Palace
content: Arsenal's defense are formidable but the signing of Eberechi Eze up front has made a real difference in tight games.

title: VAR review: Should Man United have had a penalty vs. Brighton?
content: Amad Diallo ran into the Brighton area, drawing Maxim De Cuyper into making a challenge. But was it a penalty?

title: Takeaways from Dodgers' series-tying win over Blue Jays
content: After Toronto rolled in the opener, Los Angeles rebounded to even the Fall Classic. Here's how it went down.

title: What's next: Rebook Aspinall vs. Ciryl Gane immediately
content: UFC 321 ended in disaster, but it is pretty clear what the next step is for the heavyweight division.

title: X-ray tables, marked cards and the Mafia: How the FBI says poker games were rigged
content: Details of how poker games, some involving Chauncey Billups, were allegedly rigged to make people lose big.

title: Thamel: Five questions that will define a wild CFB coaching carousel
content: Big-money buyouts, big-name candidates and more coaches under pressure. Let's break down college football's biggest coaching questions.

title: WWE 'SmackDown' highlights: McIntyre heats up title match against Rhodes
content: Friday's "SmackDown" set up a perfect "Saturday Night's Main Event," with Drew McIntyre and Cody Rhodes ready for the challenge.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Son to consider Milan loan in MLS offseason
content: Barcelona scouts are keeping tabs on Marseille striker Mason Greenwood. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Jaishankar holds talks with Malaysian PM, regional counterparts on sidelines of ASEAN summit
content: Mr. Jaishankar discussed the global and regional scenario with Singapore Counterpart Vivian Balakrishnan and deliberated on strengthening bilateral cooperation.

title: Prepare for Janjatiya Gaurav Diwas, Centre urges States
content: In a letter, the government has asked States and UTs to ‘actively participate’ in “inauguration or benefit disbursal targeting tribal populations, launch of tribal-focused schemes, capacity building” and highlighting government schemes such as PM-JANMAN

title: Tamil Nadu’s power demand remained flat in the first half of 2025-26
content: Its peak power demand has also been lower at 19,878 MW, when compared to the levels reached in the same period last year

title: Prashant Kishor’s home turf awaits verdict on Jan Suraaj promises
content: JSP leader Prashant Kishor last visited his ancestral village Konar in 2017, when his mother passed away; people here are hopeful that the leader can bring change if his candidates win the election

title: College in Vellore holds Endowment lecture
content: According to a press release, the lecture was organised in memory of Chandrabai Singhvi of the college.

title: Andhra Pradesh braces for ‘Montha’ impact as IMD issues red alert for seven districts
content: The IMD has warned that the sea condition may be ‘very rough’ along and off the Andhra Pradesh and Yanam coasts on October 27

title: Webinar on stroke prevention to be held on October 28
content: Participants will also gain insights into available treatment options and lifestyle practices that promote better brain health

title: U.P. airports see sharp rise in passenger traffic: data
content: Passenger traffic went up from 5.24 million to 6.0 million in April–August 2025 compared to the same period in 2024, govt. data shows

title: Cyclone Montha: IMD forecasts widespread rainfall in Karnataka till October 30
content: For Bengaluru city and the neighbourhood the forecast for the next 36 hours is generally cloudy skies with light to moderate rain

title: Plantation Corporation of Kerala launches  project to identify sustainable cashew farming model
content: The project tests three distinct farming models to determine the most productive and profitable approach for small and marginal farmers across south India

title: Buffalo breeding to get a boost, courtesy new yolk-free technology
content: A ready-to-use, egg yolk-free solution – CRYODIL – can preserve buffalo semen for up to 18 months; this is said to be the first time such a product has been developed and tested in India

title: Satellite for armed forces to be launched next week
content: Also known as GSAT-7R, it is a ‘multi-band communication satellite that will provide services over a wide oceanic region including the Indian landmass’, ISRO said

title: Vijay’s TVK may revise campaign strategy as it resumes activities after a nearly month-long break
content: Sources say they expect party activities to gain momentum after their founder’s meeting with the families of the Karur stampede victims in Mamallapuram on October 27

title: CBI takes over the investigation in the Karur stampede case
content: A special CBI team has been pressed into action to gather evidence, according to agency sources. The CBI re-registered the case on the directions of the Supreme Court on October 13

title: Homebuyers’ body FPCE wants changes in RERA law, pitches for rules to verify promoters’ track record
content: Forum For People's Collective Efforts president Abhay Upadhyay has written to Union Minister of Housing and Urban Affairs Manohar Lal, seeking more teeth to regulators established under the law for protecting the interests of consumers

title: Bengaluru engineer finds mention in PM Modi’s ‘Mann ki baat’ for lake rejuvenation
content: Sharma, who moved to Bengaluru from Raipur in 2001 to pursue engineering, says he fell in love with the city’s tree-lined streets

title: Japan seeks Indian workers amid ageing population, but people-to-people ties lag
content: Officials in the Cabinet Secretariat and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs point to the “perfect complementarity” between the two countries.

title: CPI(ML) manifesto promises land justice, 65% reservation for disadvantaged in Bihar
content: CPI(ML) promised government procurement of all crops and guarantee of fair prices, loan waiver for farmers and rural labourers, free electricity for agriculture, guarantee of rights and ban on eviction of sharecroppers, and restoration of Agricultural Produce Market Committee Act.

title: PM SHRI meant to propagate RSS ideals, says CPI leader and former Minister Sunil Kumar
content: The scheme is part of the National Education Policy 2020 introduced by the Union government, which, Sunil Kumar says, is an attempt to intrude into the federal rights of State governments

title: Social and Educational Survey report for Greater Bengaluru Authority area to include ‘closed,’ ‘refused’ households
content: More than 5.79 lakh households recorded as closed, refused, or unsurveyable in the last four days; completion percentage jumps to over 64%

title: Enforcement drive on private buses continues in Andhra Pradesh
content: Transport Department books 361 cases and seizes 40 vehicles in two days with Nandyal district topping in the highest number of violations

title: In home district, Nitish Kumar retains trust amid calls for fresh leadership
content: Nalanda electorate weighs legacy against change; Nitish’s untainted persona is hailed; but there are two common complaints — the growing dominance of bureaucracy and the JD(U) legislators

title: TNCSC unable to keep pace with arrivals because of labour shortage, says Union
content: Union says serious wage disparities and procedural issues have pushed many experienced hands out of work while farmers are able to complete harvesting and transport the produce within hours

title: Habitat disturbance driving human-animal conflict in Mysuru belt
content: The Sunday’s tiger attack is the second in recent days and it was less than two weeks ago that another farmer Mahadeva Gowda, lost his vision as his face was mauled in another tiger attack, also in Sargur region

title: Film and TV personalities pay tribute to actor Satish Shah
content: Shah essayed the role of Indravadhan Sarabhai, the funny and lovable patriarch of the Sarabhai family, who elicited laughs with his witty one-liners on the show ‘Sarabhai vs Sarabhai’

title: People in Telangana are happy with Congress; BRS no longer on their minds: Mahesh Goud
content: TPCC chief says the party has been rejected by the people for pushing the State into political chaos and financial distress while the ruling Congress remains deeply rooted among citizens and focused on rebuilding Telangana with welfare, transparency and balanced development

title: Central teams assess paddy moisture level in Tiruchi, Pudukkottai, and Thanjavur
content: In these districts, farmers made a common demand: the Centre authorise the State to decide on moisture content relaxation because the delay in the Centre’s approval affects procurement

title: Vice-Chancellor convenes meeting of Kerala University Syndicate on November 1
content: Various issues, including reinstatement of suspended Registrar K.S. Anil Kumar, are expected to come up for discussion at the meeting to be held after two months

title: Forest officials were coerced into acting in favour of Mohanlal in ivory case, says former Chief Wildlife Warden
content: The department did not probe the route through which the ivory reached the actor, as mandated by the Wildlife Protection Act, 1972, says Surendrakumar. Another official says the government had issued a letter asking the officials not to proceed against the actor

title: Family members of stampede victims leave for Mamallapuram to meet Vijay
content: TVK cadres meet the kin of the victims in their houses and arrange for cars to take them to Vennaimalai from where they were taken to Mamallapuram in AC buses

title: LIC unions reject Washington Post report, call it misleading
content: Unions allege the article seeks to undermine LIC’s credibility and serve U.S. insurer interests; say Adani Group investment was a Board-approved decision made without external pressure

title: State govt. on a mission to create new Kozhikode, says Minister
content: Event included a video presentation of the achievements of the State government and the Kozhikode Corporation, a report presentation, and the release of the Corpn.’s progress report

title: With 95,137 applications, liquor shop draw to be held across Telangana on October 27
content: Hyderabad received 3,201 applications for 82 shops and Secunderabad 3,022 for 97 shops while Vikarabad topped the list with 8,536 applications for 100 shops

title: 2025 local body polls: over 29.04 lakh voters in Thiruvananthapuram district
content: The number has increased by 16,828 over the previous revision, held earlier this year, and 77,902 voters compared to the voters’ list used in the 2020 local body elections.

title: Kozhikode to be declared extreme poverty-free district on Oct. 28
content: A survey conducted in 2021-22 under the aegis of various local bodies identified 6,773 families as extremely poor and provided them with assistance including food, health support, employment, and safe accommodation

title: Cyclone Montha: beaches closed, boating suspended in Godavari and Krishna rivers
content: Officials in Eluru, Krishna, and West Godavari districts on high alert as evacuations begin in low-lying coastal villages amid rough sea conditions

title: Cyclone Montha: Andhra, Odisha brace for landfall; schools shut, beach activities suspended
content: Cyclone Montha is intensifying in the Bay of Bengal, prompting coastal states of Andhra Pradesh and Odisha to prepare for landfall by late Tuesday. Authorities are evacuating vulnerable populations, closing schools, and issuing advisories as gale-force winds of 90-110 kmph are anticipated. Eight Odisha districts have been designated 'red zones' expecting severe impact.

title: India-China air travel resumes: IndiGo operates Kolkata-Guangzhou flight; first since 2020
content: Direct air connectivity between India and China has been restored with IndiGo's Kolkata-Guangzhou flight, resuming after a five-year hiatus. This crucial service, suspended due to the pandemic and diplomatic tensions, will facilitate easier travel for business and personal reasons, strengthening bilateral ties between the two nations.

title: Indian woman 'pushed into' Bangladesh: Govt moves SC; challenges HC's 'repatriate' order
content: The Centre has challenged a Calcutta High Court order to repatriate six individuals, including a pregnant woman and her child, pushed into Bangladesh as illegal immigrants. The court had ordered their return within four weeks, a deadline that has now passed. The families are reportedly planning further legal action to ensure the implementation of the repatriation order.

title: 'Followed Basavaraj's call': Naxal leader Rupesh on surrender; rejects 'traitor' tag
content: A surrendered Maoist leader, Rupesh, refutes the 'traitor' label, claiming he and others followed slain chief Basavaraj's directive to cease armed conflict and pursue peace talks. Rupesh alleges current leadership, including Devji, is withholding Basavaraj's final call from cadres, suggesting a failure to communicate the party's shift towards ending the insurgency.

title: GM layoffs: Engineers fired on Microsoft Teams; Says it's business, not you
content: General Motors has let go of over 200 salaried employees, mainly CAD engineers, at its Michigan tech campus. This move, part of a restructuring to boost profits, follows strong third-quarter earnings and a raised financial outlook. GM stated the layoffs target execution roles to enhance core design capabilities. This comes as the automotive sector sees broader workforce reductions.

title: 'Will prevent misuse': Rajasthan cracks down over midday meal 'theft'; 5 teachers suspended
content: Five government schoolteachers in Rajasthan were suspended for allegedly selling milk powder meant for mid-day meals to sweet manufacturers. A high-level committee is investigating the incident, with a report due in four days. The education department is implementing stricter checks on food stock and distribution to prevent future misuse.

title: 'Foul play': Odisha NEET aspirant found dead in Kota hostel; family seeks thorough probe
content: Family members of Roshan Patra, a NEET aspirant found dead in his Kota hostel room, suspect foul play and demand a thorough investigation. The 24-year-old from Ganjam was preparing for the exam. His father reported a normal conversation just two days prior.

title: OnePlus OxygenOS 16 update: Full list of eligible devices, rollout date, and key features
content: OnePlus has unveiled OxygenOS 16, built on Android 16, featuring a visual refresh with 'Liquid Glass' design and a translucent floating bar. The update introduces powerful AI tools like Private Computing Cloud and an AI Writer Toolkit. Rollout begins November 2025 for select devices, with more to follow.

title: 'Greed for power': Tejashwi counters Chirag's 'no Muslim CM' charge; questions his 'vision'
content: Tejashwi Yadav accused Chirag Paswan of power greed, claiming he compromised his political stand by joining the ruling alliance. Yadav's remarks followed Paswan's accusation that the RJD opposed a Muslim chief minister in 2005 and continues to do so, urging minority communities to reconsider their loyalty.

title: Screams, smoke, shattered glass: Horrific memories of Kurnool bus fire haunt survivors
content: Survivors of the Kurnool bus fire recount fragmented horrors of screams, smoke, and a desperate fight for life, haunted by those they couldn't save.  Meanwhile, devastated families await DNA results to claim the bodies of the 19 deceased, with postmortem and sample collection completed at the accident site.

title: Trump wants a 'Golden Fleet' to fight China because he hates 'ugly ships': Report
content: President Trump is reportedly pushing for a "Golden Fleet" of advanced U.S. Navy warships, equipped with long-range and potentially hypersonic missiles, to counter China's growing influence. Discussions involve a new, heavily armored ship design. While the White House hints at an announcement, some experts urge prioritizing existing ship maintenance over new aesthetics.

title: GitHub is in trouble from AI; Gates complained, Nadella agrees
content: Microsoft is revamping GitHub to tackle AI coding rivals like Cursor and Claude Code. CEO Satya Nadella highlighted the need to unify development tools, drawing parallels to Bill Gates' past vision.  The platform aims to integrate AI across all developer workflows, ensuring choice in models and surfaces to regain developer mindshare.

title: Shashi Tharoor reviews Aryan Khan’s The Ba***ds of Bollywood
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has taken to social media to applaud Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan’s son Aryan Khan for his debut show, The Ba***ds of Bollywood, which is now streaming online. Struggling with a cold and cough, Tharoor revealed that he had cancelled his engagements for two days. Persuaded by his staff and sister Smita Tharoor, he decided to turn his attention to the series and was instantly hooked.

title: Flying into the US? You will be photographed; entered into facial recognition database
content: US Customs and Border Protection will expand its biometric tracking, photographing nearly all non-US citizens entering or departing the country. This new rule, effective soon, aims to enhance national security and combat fraudulent travel by creating a comprehensive facial-recognition database.  It eliminates previous age exemptions and applies to all non-citizens, including lawful permanent residents.

title: Hailee Steinfeld reveals 11pm emergency therapy call while Josh Allen faces Bills' slump
content: Actress Hailee Steinfeld candidly shared her struggles with career and relationship pressures, detailing a late-night therapy session prompted by doubts about balancing ambitions. Her personal newsletter, Beau Society, now on Substack, offers fans intimate insights. Meanwhile, her husband, NFL star Josh Allen, aims to lead the Buffalo Bills back to winning ways amidst their own public scrutiny.

title: Luka Doncic injury update: Lakers star likely to play vs Kings tonight
content: Lakers' superstar Luka Doncic is questionable for tonight's game against the Kings due to a sprained left finger. Despite this, he's had a phenomenal start to the season, averaging 46 points. With LeBron James also sidelined, the Lakers face a thin rotation, relying heavily on Austin Reaves and new additions. The game's outcome could significantly impact early Pacific Division momentum.

title: Joe Alwyn’s old moment with Taylor Swift sparks outrage as fans hail Travis Kelce
content: Taylor Swift's upcoming wedding to Travis Kelce has fans buzzing, especially after a resurfaced clip from 2022 showing her with ex Joe Alwyn sparked outrage.  Fans criticized Alwyn's apparent rush to avoid paparazzi, contrasting it with Kelce's public support for Swift's success.  The couple remains private about their wedding details.

title: Israel strikes southern Lebanon; kills 2 Hezbollah operatives
content: The IDF announced Sunday it killed two Hezbollah operatives in southern Lebanon, targeting individuals involved in weapons procurement and local representation. These strikes occurred amid ongoing border tensions and alleged violations of the November 2024 ceasefire. The operation coincided with a visit by the Israeli defense minister and a US envoy to the Lebanon border.

title: Brother wins tax case after Income Tax Department questions Rs 10 lakh gift from sisters
content: A businessman successfully proved cash gifts from his sisters were legitimate, avoiding tax evasion charges. The Income Tax Appellate Tribunal ruled in his favor, accepting documented property sale proceeds and bank records as proof of the donors' financial capacity.

title: Real Madrid end El Clasico woes; defeat Barcelona 2-1 at Santiago Bernabeu
content: Real Madrid surged five points clear in La Liga after a thrilling 2-1 El Clásico victory over Barcelona at the Bernabéu. Jude Bellingham netted the winner, building on Kylian Mbappé's opener, as Xabi Alonso's men overcame Barcelona's possession dominance. As Barcelona battled the challenges with key absences, Madrid showcased their resilience and clinical finishing to secure a crucial win.

title: '5 soldiers, 25 militants killed': Pak reports fresh border clashes with Afghanistan
content: Pakistan reported five soldiers and 25 militants killed in border clashes with Afghanistan, despite ongoing peace talks in Istanbul. The military questioned the timing of these attacks, suggesting doubts about the interim Afghan government's commitment to curbing terrorism. Islamabad has urged Kabul to manage its borders effectively and prevent Afghan soil from being used against Pakistan.

title: 'No communication': Rahane's strong message to selectors
content: Ajinkya Rahane expressed his readiness for India's Australia tour, lamenting a lack of communication regarding his selection. He emphasized that experience and passion for red-ball cricket are more important than age, citing seasoned players like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. Rahane also advised young talent Sarfaraz Khan to focus on scoring runs and controlling what he can.

title: Cam Skattebo Injury: Giants RB carted off with scary leg issue, season in doubt
content: Giants rookie running back Cam Skattebo sustained a serious leg injury during Sunday's match against the Eagles. The 23-year-old's promising season has been dealt a blow. Skattebo was carted off the field after his leg twisted awkwardly. The team awaits an official diagnosis, but the injury appears significant. This setback adds to the Giants' ongoing offensive challenges.

title: Crackdown on terror: J&K police tighten noose; accused's Rs 70 lakh property attached
content: Jammu and Kashmir police have attached immovable property valued at approximately Rs 70 lakh belonging to terrorism accused Mohammed Jahangir, believed to be residing in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. This action, targeting over 2 acres in Poonch district, is part of an intensified crackdown on terrorist financing networks operating from across the border.

title: Religious conversion attempt? Kathua villagers allege bid; FIR lodged
content: Police in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district have registered a case against unidentified individuals accused of attempting to lure villagers into religious conversion. This follows an incident where locals reportedly attacked religious preachers, leading to the suspension of eight police personnel. Allegations of forced religious conversion by missionaries have surfaced previously in the region.

title: Nick Mangold dies at 41 after kidney battle; former Jets star’s net worth revealed
content: Beloved New York Jets center Nick Mangold has passed away at 41 due to chronic kidney disease complications. Mangold, a seven-time Pro Bowler and two-time All-Pro, recently revealed he was on dialysis and seeking a kidney donor. His decade-long career with the Jets was marked by exceptional leadership and toughness, leaving a significant legacy.

title: ‘Rape charges, marriage proposal’: Fresh revelations in Maha doctor suicide; probe takes a twist
content: A 28-year-old doctor's suicide in Satara has taken a disturbing turn with allegations of rape by a police sub-inspector and a techie.  The deceased, from Beed, left a note on her palm implicating the sub-inspector and another individual for five months of torment. Authorities have apprehended both accused in connection with the alleged rape and abetment of suicide.

title: Cardiologist warns of a hidden health threat deadlier than cholesterol and BP
content: Doctors are highlighting a new danger in our blood. Tiny plastic pieces are being found in artery plaque. This discovery shows a much higher risk of heart attack and stroke. Experts say this plastic threat is overlooked. It could be more harmful than high cholesterol or blood pressure. Understanding this risk is crucial for everyone's heart health.

title: 'Time well spent' - Rohit reveals how long break fueled his strong return
content: Rohit Sharma credits a rare extended break for his stellar performance in the recent ODI series against Australia. This period allowed him to mentally and physically prepare, focusing on his career's future. His century in the final ODI, alongside Virat Kohli, showcased the blend of experience and mentorship crucial for the Indian team.

title: ‘Drunk drivers are terrorists’: Hyderabad top cop on Kurnool bus fire
content: Hyderabad Police Commissioner VC Sajjanar declared drunk drivers as terrorists following a tragic bus fire that killed 20 people in Kurnool. He emphasized that the incident, caused by an intoxicated biker, was a preventable massacre, not an accident. Sajjanar vowed a zero-tolerance approach to drunk driving in Hyderabad, stating such acts will be punished as crimes.

title: Former Jets star Nick Mangold dies at 41 after kidney battle, leaving lasting legacy
content: Former New York Jets center Nick Mangold has died at age 41 due to complications from kidney disease. The respected leader and cornerstone of the Jets' offensive line for over a decade had recently revealed he was undergoing dialysis and seeking a transplant donor. Mangold's toughness, loyalty, and leadership defined an era for the franchise.

title: Delhi horror: 'Stalker' throws acid at 20-year-old student; probe launched
content: A 20-year-old woman from Mukundpur, Delhi, was injured in an acid attack by three men, including acquaintance Jitender, following a month-old argument. She sustained burns on both hands and is admitted to Deep Chand Bandhu Hospital. Police have registered a case under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS), and the Crime and FSL teams are investigating the incident.

title: Women lead full-time MBA applications: Growth seen worldwide; flexible programmes rise
content: Women have surpassed men in applications to full-time MBA programmes worldwide, according to the GMAC 2025 Application Trends Survey. Full-time, two-year MBA programmes saw 63% of schools reporting growth in female applicants, while online and flex MBA programmes also experienced increases. Women make up roughly 41% of full-time MBA applicants and dominate Master of Marketing and Accounting applications. Executive MBA and Master of Finance programmes remain male-dominated. Flexible and online formats continue to attract higher female representation globally.

title: Explained: Why Canada's visa system is facing a meltdown
content: Canada's immigration system is facing unprecedented challenges as visa rejections surge across visitor, study, and work categories in 2025. This sharp decline, impacting hundreds of thousands of potential arrivals, is attributed to the increased use of automated decision-making tools like Chinook, leading to generic refusal letters and concerns about fairness and transparency.

title: US-China trade talks: 'Substantial framework' reached ahead of Trump-Xi meet
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent announced a substantial framework to prevent 100% tariffs on Chinese goods and defer rare earths export controls. High-level talks in Kuala Lumpur preceded this development, aiming for more balanced trade, agricultural purchases, and fentanyl crisis measures. The framework is expected to be finalized by Presidents Trump and Xi.

title: Injury scare for India! Pratika Rawal hobbles off with ankle twist - Watch
content: India's World Cup campaign faced a significant setback as opener Pratika Rawal sustained a twisted ankle during the match against Bangladesh.  The in-form batter hobbled off, raising concerns about her availability for the crucial semifinal against Australia.  Rawal's absence would be a major blow, given her stellar performances, including a recent century.

title: Explained: TN Private Universities Amendment Bill; reasons behind the backlash
content: The Tamil Nadu Private Universities (Amendment) Bill 2025 has sparked backlash from universities, students, and stakeholders due to changes in approvals, governance, and compliance. Key concerns include retroactive validation of past notifications, stricter oversight, alignment of medical courses with NMC standards, and rigid requirements for sponsoring bodies. Following widespread objections, the Education Minister announced a review of the Bill. The government aims to balance regulatory clarity with operational flexibility while ensuring legal and national compliance for private universities.

title: Nick Mangold reveals chronic kidney disease, begins urgent search for donor
content: Former New York Jets star Nick Mangold, a seven-time Pro Bowler, is bravely battling chronic kidney disease. Diagnosed with a genetic defect in 2006, the 41-year-old is now undergoing dialysis and urgently seeking a type O kidney donor.  Mangold expressed gratitude for the overwhelming support from fans and the football community as he faces this significant health challenge.

title: 'Birth-based ruling class': Dynasts lead candidate lists in Bihar polls
content: In a region where political awareness runs deep despite limited economic and educational progress, dynastic influence remains an unbroken thread. As Bihar heads into assembly elections, the hold of family-based politics spans parties and ideologies alike — from the RJD to the BJP — reflecting how lineage continues to shape leadership in one of India’s most politically conscious states.

title: 'Fantastic effort' - Rohit lauds young India pacer despite ODI series defeat
content: Rohit Sharma's unbeaten 121 powered India to a nine-wicket win against Australia in the third ODI, though the series was lost 1-2.  Sharma lauded young Harshit Rana's performance and reflected on the tough Australian opposition. He detailed his strategic approach to the innings and praised his partnership with Virat Kohli, highlighting their mutual understanding and experience.

title: Not done yet: 'Ro-Ko' turn back the clock, script their own ending Down Under
content: On a golden Sydney evening, two men who have defined Indian cricket for over a decade found themselves writing the perfect epilogue. Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma — both long retired from Tests and T20Is — walked out one last time in blue on Australian soil. The result wasn’t just a win; it was a resurrection — a poetic reminder that their story, even now, isn’t done.

title: Understanding metastatic prostate cancer in men over 70
content: Prostate cancer screening for men over 70 is complex, with current recommendations against routine PSA testing due to slow growth and treatment side effects. However, evolving life expectancies prompt expert calls for updated guidelines. Metastatic prostate cancer, which has spread beyond the prostate, is more serious and requires management rather than a cure.

title: Madhya Pradesh: Out on bail, man attacks judge's house; arrested along with 2 aides
content:
3 arrested for attack on MP judge's house

BHOPAL: A man, allegedly angered by the rejection of his bail plea, vandalised the official residence of judicial magistrate first class Amandeep Singh Chhabra, 39, in Anuppur district of Madhya Pradesh late Saturday, police said Sunday. Police registered an FIR and launched an investigation. Accused Priyanshu alias Jaguar Singh, 25, Devendra Kevat alias Sonu, 23, and Manikesh Singh alias Puttan, 19 were traced and arrested. Police also seized the motorcycle allegedly used in the attack. Anuppur superintendent of police (SP) Moti Ur Rehman said: "Main accused Priyanshu was charged in a case three to four months ago and his bail plea was rejected by Chhabra. He later secured bail from additional sessions judge. Out on bail, he and his accomplices vandalised Chhabra's house and threatened to kill him. All three have been arrested."

End of Article

title: Who said what? Take our college football Week 9 quotes quiz
content: Lane Kiffin starts his interview by quipping with an Oklahoma defender who said Ole Miss wouldn't score on them. (0:40) Week 9 of college football's 2025 regular season was exciting. A number of Top 25 teams won games that were decided by a single score. Just to name a few: No. 4  Alabama  eked out a  29-22 win  over  South Carolina , No. 8  Ole Miss  outlasted No. 13  Oklahoma   34-28 , No. 10  Vanderbilt  beat No. 17  Missouri   17-10 , No. 16  Virginia  beat Bill Belichick's  North Carolina   17-16 , and No. 22  Texas  needed overtime to beat  Mississippi State   45-38 . Saturday produced some great quotes from college football coaches. Can you guess who said what?

title: AP Week 9 poll reaction: What's next for each Top 25 team
